title: Barcelona Coach Not Interested In Move For Inter Milan Target Despite Presidential Pressure
description: Inter Milan remain in a holding pattern over Jo√£o Cancelo, as doubts persist in Barcelona despite growing pressure on coach Hansi Flick from the club‚Äôs hierarchy.According to La Gazzetta dello Spor...
fullText:
Inter Milan remain in a holding pattern over Jo√£o Cancelo, as doubts persist in Barcelona despite growing pressure on coach Hansi Flick from the club‚Äôs hierarchy.

According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, Inter had hoped to close the deal with a quick breakthrough.

However, they have instead been forced to wait as Cancelo hesitates.

The Portuguese defender is keen to play Champions League football in the build-up to the 2026 World Cup and believes his chances of lifting the trophy may be higher with Barcelona than in Milan.

Inter already have an agreement in principle with Al-Hilal, who are willing to cover a significant portion of Cancelo‚Äôs salary in exchange for one experienced defender.

LISBON, PORTUGAL ‚Äì MARCH 5: Head Coach Hans-Dieter Flick of FC Barcelona in action during the UEFA Champions League 2024/25 Round of 16 First Leg match between SL Benfica and FC Barcelona at Estadio da Luz on March 5, 2025 in Lisbon, Portugal. (Photo by Gualter Fatia/Getty Images)

Either Francesco Acerbi or Stefan de Vrij would move in the opposite direction, but only once Cancelo gives the green light.

The problem for Barcelona is technical rather than political.

Head coach Hansi Flick is not convinced by the idea of signing Cancelo.

Indeed prioritising instead a left-footed central defender.

Flick also remains unconvinced by the idea of moving Jules Kound√© inside permanently.

Flick is aware the club have room for only one major addition under Financial Fair Play rules.

Indeed, he does not want to ‚Äúwaste‚Äù that slot.

While Jorge Mendes continues to lobby president Joan Laporta, Inter remain cautiously optimistic.

Cristian Chivu has privately endorsed the move.

However, Inter are unwilling to wait indefinitely as both clubs, and Al-Hilal, await Cancelo‚Äôs final call.

title: 3 Things to watch for in Cavs vs Pistons
description: The Cavs have a chance to make a statement against Detroit.
fullText:
The Cleveland Cavaliers are ready for their biggest game of the year (so far) against the top-seeded Detroit Pistons. This one begins at 2 PM in Rocket Arena.

Cleveland entered this season as the favorites to win the Eastern Conference. That has slipped away from them as the months go by, and the Pistons climb further in front as the best team in the East. Detroit is 25-9 and has a six-game lead over the Cavaliers.

The Cavs have struggled early in this season, that‚Äôs no doubt. But they‚Äôve been turning it around as of late and have a better offensive, defensive and net rating than Detroit since Dec. 22nd. And even though the Pistons are first in the East, they still only have the fourth highest odds of winning the conference once the playoffs start. New York, Cleveland and Boston remain ahead of them.

All this being said, there‚Äôs a lot on the line in this one. Both Cleveland and Detroit feel like this is an opportunity to make a statement. Let‚Äôs see who does it.

Comment on articles, community posts

New, improved notifications system!

It‚Äôs not a coincidence that Cleveland has begun turning their season around just as three-point shots have started to fall.

The Cavs rank 22nd in three-point percentage this season. That‚Äôs never going to be good enough for a team like the Cavs to compete on a nightly basis. They aren‚Äôt built to consistently win games any other way.

Since Dec. 22nd, however, Cleveland is 4th in three-point shooting. That‚Äôs more like it. A Cavs team that can bombard teams from downtown is the type of team that can win any given game.

In typical J.B. Bickerstaff fashion, Detroit has surprised the league by winning its games on the defensive end.

The Pistons are the 2nd-best defense in the NBA, behind only the reigning champion Oklahoma City Thunder. This team has grit-and-grinded its way to being a powerhouse in the Eastern Conference.

Ron Holland and Ausar Thompson are a dynamic defensive duo on the wing that can make this game difficult for Cleveland‚Äôs guards. Keep an eye on how Darius Garland and Donovan Mitchell fare in this one, because they may have to find solutions to Detroit‚Äôs defense at some point in the playoffs.

title: Kyren Williams, Blake Corum injury news: Who will start at running back for Rams in Week 18
description: Kyren Williams and Blake Corum are dealing with injuries heading into Week 18. We break down what it means for fantasy football decisions.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Rams are facing the Arizona Cardinals in Week 18 to close out the regular season, and they face some notable roster decisions. The running back is among them with Kyren Williams and Blake Corum both listed as questionable for Sunday‚Äôs game.

The Rams are locked into a wild card and will be either the No. 5 or No. 6 seed. The 49ers loss to the Seahawks on Saturday night means that the Rams will be the No. 5 seed if they beat the Cardinals and the No. 6 seed if they lose to the Cardinals. Rams head coach Sean McVay said on Friday that he would play his starters, but the injury report suggests otherwise. The team has ruled out starting cornerback Josh Wallace and starting right guard Kevin Dotson, and numerous starters are listed as questionable.

Kyren Williams and Blake Corum both entered the week dealing with ankle injuries. Williams was limited in all three practice sessions this week and has a questionable designation heading into game day. Blake Corum sat out practice on Wednesday and Thursday, but then got in a limited session on Friday before getting his own questionable designation.

Corum seems on the wrong side of questionable and is likely to sit the regular season finale. Williams seems more likely to be able to go. If Williams plays the full game, he is a strong fantasy option ‚Äî especially with Corum potentially sidelined. The question though is whether or not Williams plays the full game.

Ronnie Rivers and Jarquez Hunter are the two reserve options. Either could be an interesting dart throw in DFS or if you‚Äôre desperate in a fantasy football championship. The problem is that even if we know Williams will not play or only play limited snaps, it‚Äôs unclear which of Rivers or Hunter benefits. I would probably shy away from Williams given the uncertainty for the Rams.

title: Is Miami‚Äôs edge rusher Rueben Bain the best player in the 2026 NFL draft?
description: A collection of articles, podcasts & tweets from around the web to keep you in touch with the Commanders, the NFC East, the NFL and sports in general, and a sprinkling of other stuff
fullText:
We have elevated DT Ricky Barber and WR River Cracraft from the practice squad pic.twitter.com/LnFS6NHTYI

‚Äî Washington Commanders (@Commanders) January 3, 2026

Kingsbury will be a hot name this offseason despite having a down year for the Commanders, but will he actually leave? He‚Äôs already been linked to the Tennessee Titans and Las Vegas Raiders job as a fit, but what about going to a division rival? ESPN‚Äôs Jordan Raanan said the Giants will cast a wide net in their head coaching search, but Kingsbury might be on the outside looking in.

‚ÄúCommanders‚Äô offensive coordinator Kingsbury, who also has experience as an NFL head coach with the Cardinals, is considered a bright offensive mind. The question is if he‚Äôs the right fit for the New York market.‚Äù ‚Äì Jordan Raanan, ESPN

The Giants interview list includes Mike McCarthy, Chris Shula, Antonio Pierce and more as they cast a wide net. https://t.co/o2weOafxQt

‚Äî Jordan Raanan (@JordanRaanan) January 2, 2026

It would be a surprise if Kingsbury doesn‚Äôt even get an interview with the Giants, given his track record with young quarterbacks, and what he could do with Jaxson Dart. It sounds like they could be interested in Kingsbury, but he‚Äôs likely more of a tier two or tier three candidate for the Giants.

The former TCU standout is getting a look down the stretch with Tunsil out. Coleman looks more accomplished and urgent in everything he does. He is not the finished article by any stretch of the imagination, but his upturn in consistency indicates that all hope is not lost just yet.

This hasn‚Äôt gone unnoticed by Quinn. The coach thinks Coleman has learned a great deal in his second campaign. The athletic upside has always been there, but the lineman has developed a new sense of resilience that is standing him in exceptional stead.

‚ÄúI think‚Ä¶he has learned a lot here in year two. This is a resilient guy that can do a lot of things based on his athleticism, him learning and going through the hard moments.‚ÄùDan Quinn via Commanders.com

Coleman will start at left tackle again in Week 18 against the Philadelphia Eagles if he gets the all-clear to participate. He‚Äôs listed as questionable with a knee problem, but he practiced in full on Friday. That‚Äôs a positive sign, which gives him a fighting chance of finishing his campaign on a high note.

The Commanders elevated Cracraft from the practice squad to the active roster Saturday ahead of Sunday‚Äôs game against the Eagles. Cracraft has been elevated for consecutive weeks, finishing Christmas Day‚Äôs loss against the Cowboys with just one snap on the special-teams unit. With Terry McLaurin, Deebo Samuel, Treylon Burks and Chris Moore all healthy and active, Cracraft is likely in line to see the same minimal special-teams snap share in Sunday‚Äôs game.

1) What were your big takeaways from the Week 16 matchup between the Commanders and Eagles?

I do think it‚Äôs silly how the Commanders took such offense to the Eagles going for two late in the game. Why wait until then to show that kind of fight? Also, laughable to hear Dan Quinn talk tough about how Washington was going to see the Eagles again in two weeks. When it seemed like the Eagles will be resting their starters, which we now know is exactly the case. For Quinn to be afraid of going for it on fourth down (punted on 4th-and-4 from the minus 40-yard line down 11 with 9 minutes to go ‚Ä¶ and punted on 4th-and-6 from the minus 44-yard line down 11 with just 6:44 to go) and then act all tough in the postgame presser? That‚Äôs unserious behavior to me.

2) How far do you think the Eagles will get in the post-season and what do you think will be their biggest secret to success or stumbling block?

I think the Eagles can win the Super Bowl. Vic Fangio‚Äôs defense is awesome. Jalen Hurts has played well in the biggest games of his career. There is no juggernaut the Eagles simply can‚Äôt beat.

Do you expect the Commanders will try especially hard this week or are they going to pack it in and rest key players with an eye to the 2026 season? How do fans want the team to approach this game?

I don‚Äôt know that the Commanders will try especially hard to win, but they will certainly try as hard to win as they did in the last matchup (where the playoffs were already out of reach). Reports are that Dan Quinn still has the locker room, the players are still bought in, and the coaches and players still want to win games. So I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll try their hardest to win, just like last time, but the deck will be stacked against them due to all their injuries.

The decision to rest or play starters is not just about protecting players or gaining draft position, it‚Äôs also about putting together some good tape so the front office can actually evaluate the talent on the team. So many players have been injured or are returning from injury, so many players have been moved to different positions or roles (particularly on defense) due to injuries and due to Dan Quinn taking over the defense a few weeks ago, that it‚Äôs probably more important for the front office to get additional tape on these players playing their best in order to evaluate them than it is to get a slightly higher draft spot. What good does a better draft pick do if you can‚Äôt even evaluate your biggest team needs effectively? For this reason, as well as for pride and division rivalry, I think most fans will be rooting for the starters to play and the team to play well. In my opinion, the only reason to tank is if you need a top 2 pick for a QB, quality players at other positions can be found later in the draft.

Tampa Bay‚Äôs 16-14 win over the Panthers keeps it alive, but now the Bucs need the Saints to beat the Falcons to make the postseason.

the showdown game for first place in the NFC South did not yield a division winner, at least not yet.

So it went on the opening day of the final weekend of the NFL‚Äôs regular season. The Seahawks beat the San Francisco 49ers in Santa Clara, California, to secure the NFC West title and the conference‚Äôs No. 1 playoff seed. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers defeated the Carolina Panthers but will have to wait until Sunday to see whether that will be enough for them to win the NFC South.

The playoff field is taking shape and will be fully formed when Sunday‚Äôs play is done.

The Buccaneers helped their postseason cause. But they didn‚Äôt punch their playoff ticket, at least not yet.

The opening game of the final weekend of the NFL‚Äôs regular season did not determine as much as it could have. The Buccaneers beat the Panthers, 16-14, in the rain Saturday at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa. But they will have to wait until Sunday to find out whether they will secure their fifth straight NFC South title and the NFC‚Äôs No. 4 playoff seed.

They need the Atlanta Falcons to lose Sunday to the New Orleans Saints. If the Falcons beat the Saints, that would create a three-way tie for the division lead with matching 8-9 records. The Panthers would win the division in that case, based on tiebreakers.

‚ÄúWe did everything we could today,‚Äù Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield told ESPN afterward. ‚ÄúSit back and see what happens tomorrow.‚Äù

The final show@BankofAmerica | #RaiseHail pic.twitter.com/UoGpgmFVLs

‚Äî Washington Commanders (@Commanders) January 4, 2026

Commanders edge rusher Von Miller needs one sack Sunday vs. the Eagles to finish the season with nine sacks and collect another $500,000 in incentives. pic.twitter.com/eDSPxZ9Lls

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 4, 2026

Commanders WR Deebo Samuel has $650,000 on the line Sunday vs. the Eagles. Samuel needs 10 catches to collect another $200,000 incentive, 93 receiving yards for another $200,000 and two touchdowns to collect another $250,000. pic.twitter.com/gQrYMPtYg9

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 4, 2026

Reminder that 49ers had only punted twice since Week 13 coming into this game üò≥

The Seattle defense stepped up pic.twitter.com/15Rz5s3F5l

QBs with back-to-back 14+ win seasons in NFL history:

‚Ä¢ Sam Darnold (2024-2025)

That‚Äôs the list. https://t.co/VKtzhXl33x pic.twitter.com/wSrqvTUArk

‚Äî Ari Meirov (@MySportsUpdate) January 4, 2026

title: What Javonte Williams, Malik Davis injury news means for Cowboys RB Jaydon Blue in Week 18
description: Javonte Williams and Malik Davis are both out for the Cowboys‚Äô Week 18 finale due to injuries. We break down what it means for Jaydon Blue fantasy football decisions.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have been playing out the string on a lost 2025-26 season, and they wrap things up on Sunday when they travel to face the New York Giants in Week 18. The Cowboys have nothing to play for other than pride, and they‚Äôll be missing some key players in this game. Most notably on offense, they will be without running backs Javonte Williams and Malik Davis. That opens the door for Jaydon Blue to make his first start since the Cowboys drafted him in the fifth round of the 2025 NFL Draft.

Williams seemed fine heading into this week, but then was added to the Thursday practice participation report. He sat out Thursday with shoulder and neck issues. He was a DNP again on Friday before being ruled out on the final injury report. Davis showed up on the injury report on Wednesday with calf and eye issues. He was a DNP all three weeks before being ruled out. The Cowboys placed both players on injured reserve to officially end their seasons.

It is a good bet that Blue gets the bulk of Sunday‚Äôs workload. The team activated running back Phil Mafah, but look for him to serve as no more than a depth option.

Blue has 22 carries for 65 yards and a five-yard reception this season. His biggest opportunity came in Week 7 and Week 8 when he had 15 of those carries for 58 yards. He had a fumble in Week 8, and that likely didn‚Äôt help him make his case for more work. Since then, he hasn‚Äôt touched the ball or even had an offensive snap. This week, he very well could match his season totals. He‚Äôs got talent, but at the very least he is an interesting volume play for Week 18 fantasy championships and DFS.

title: Joan Garc√≠a¬†returns to haunt Espanyol and shows why he is Barelona‚Äôs MVP
description: The goalkeeper put on a show in the derby.
fullText:
Joan Garc√≠a is a human highlight reel.

Beyond that, he is the reason Barcelona can win games even when they‚Äôre not at their best. That‚Äôs what a world class goalkeeper can do for you.

Espanyol are one of the best teams in Spain at the moment, and you could see why on Saturday. They are organized and tough to break down, and have an incredible confidence about them under Manolo Gonz√°lez.

Over the summer, Barcelona poached their goalkeeper, and the cross town rivals somehow have only gotten better.

The fans at Cornell√†¬†were rabid, as they always are when the Blaugrana visit. The question on the night was how Joan Garc√≠a would deal with the pressure of coming back to his old stomping ground with the mission of keeping his team‚Äôs cushion at the top of the table in Spain.

It wasn‚Äôt an easy match, and perhaps Espanyol deserved something from it. Joan Garc√≠a, in the end, was the difference maker, and gave his team multiple chances to stay alive, while ultimately finding the breakthrough to win the game.

Seeing him make those incredible saves is worth the price of admission. Did you ever think, being a Barcelona fan, that the goalkeeper of all people would be the one making the most exciting plays on the field?

There is no panic in that man. He stays calm, even when faced with the most unlikely of circumstances, squares up the attacking player in front of him, and somehow finds a way, time and time again, to come out on top.

One versus one with the keeper to beat? No so fast.

A point blank header? Easy work.

One of your own defenders getting in the way? Sayonara Gerard Mart√≠n.

That is exactly how you want to start the new year if you‚Äôre Barcelona. We‚Äôre at the point in the season where the stakes are high, but the team can rest easier knowing they have one of the best shot stoppers in the world.

With that fact anchoring you, it comes down to the goal scorers doing their job.

Hansi Flick did well to make the changes he made in the second half. Dani Olmo and Ferm√≠n L√≥pez were the men for the job on the night, and made it count when finally, in the dying moments of the game, their number was called.

These are the types of games that, when you look back on it, win you trophies.

I have my concerns about Barcelona this season. They are an imperfect team, and when it comes down to it, especially in cup competitions, I worry they could be their own worst enemies.

Seeing Joan Garc√≠a perform at this level, however, makes me believe that they could very well make it through even on the toughest of nights.

If we feel this way about him as fans, imagine what it does for the confidence of the players.

Instead of waiting for the other shoe to drop when they aren‚Äôt playing well, they know they can keep battling until the breakthrough moment appears.

Joan Garc√≠a has arrived, and that should give Barcelona hope heading into the new year that good things are around the corner.

title: Green Bay Packers at Minnesota Vikings: Game Time, Broadcast Info, Radio and More
description: One last game day for this season
fullText:
It‚Äôs the final game day of the 2025 NFL season for our Minnesota Vikings, as they‚Äôll be hosting the Green Bay Packers this afternoon in the regular season finale. We want everyone to be able to follow along with all of the action from U.S. Bank Stadium by whichever means they‚Äôd like, so we‚Äôre going to put all of that info here in one place for you.

Because this is a low-stakes contest in the grand scheme of things this week in the NFL, we get to kick things off at the best possible time for NFL action to get underway, that being noon Central time on Sunday. This game will be covered by the CBS family of networks, including WCCO-4 in the Twin Cities, with Spero Dedes and Adam Archuleta on the call. If you‚Äôre wondering whether or not you‚Äôre in the local broadcast area for this one, here‚Äôs this week‚Äôs map from the folks at 506 Sports, with the Packers/Vikings game represented by the blue area.

If you‚Äôre not in the local broadcast area, you‚Äôll have to rely on YouTube TV NFL Sunday Ticket.

For our men and women in uniform serving overseas, the American Forces Network will. . .surprisingly enough. . .be bring you this one LIVE on AFN Sports. Kickoff is slated for 1800Z, which works out to 1900L for viewers in Central Europe, 2100L for everyone in Iraq and Kuwait, and 0300L on Monday morning for fans in Japan and Korea.

If you‚Äôre going to be traveling or just prefer to listen to things through the magic of radio, we have updated our list of¬†Vikings Radio Network¬†affiliates for this season. Wherever you are in the upper Midwest, you should be covered.

If you have satellite radio, you can catch the Vikings feed on Channel 229. If you‚Äôre utilizing the SiriusXM app, you can listen on the Vikings‚Äô permanent home there, which is Channel 820.

According to the folks from Football Zebras, the officiating crew for this week‚Äôs game will be led by John Hussey. This will be the first time that the Vikings have seen his crew since last season. . .it was his crew that officiated the Vikings‚Äô loss to the Los Angeles Rams in last year‚Äôs Wild Card round.

Yep, the weather isn‚Äôt going to affect this one, folks, since it‚Äôs going to be played indoors at U.S. Bank Stadium. If you‚Äôre going to be headed out to one last tailgate. . .well, according to our friends at WeatherNation, it‚Äôs going to be a bit unpleasant. Temperatures will get into the mid-20s by kickoff, but there‚Äôs going to be some freezing rain starting around 11 AM, changing to snow in the early afternoon, which should make for an absolutely delightful trip home for everyone in attendance at today‚Äôs game. Drive carefully, folks.

The line for this one has changed significantly since things opened up earlier in the week. The Vikings opened the week as a 5.5-point favorite, but as news has come in through the week, that number has ballooned to the point where the Vikings are now a whopping 10.5-point favorite over the Packers, according to FanDuel. The over/under on the game has not changed, as that number still rests at 36.5 points.

I believe if you have NFL+ and you live in the local area, you can stream the game on one of your devices. Otherwise, NFL Sunday Ticket is your lone legal streaming option, as far as I can tell. I don‚Äôt care about illegal streaming options.

That should be everything you need to be able to follow along with all of the action of today‚Äôs 2025 regular season finale for our Minnesota Vikings, folks. As always, we will have our first Open Thread of the day dropping about half an hour before kickoff at 11:30 AM Central time, and we hope to see a lot of you there as we wrap up this 2025 season.

title: Cowboys news: Matt Eberflus decision awaits Dallas after final game
description: Your Sunday morning Cowboys news.
fullText:
After a disappointing season defensively, the Cowboys could be making a move at defensive coordinator but nothing concrete as of yet.

The Dallas Cowboys are reportedly expected to make some changes to their defensive coaching staff at the end of the 2025 season. According to NFL.com‚Äôs¬†Ian Rapoport and Tom Pelissero, it is ‚Äúlikely‚Äù some new coaches will be brought in on the defensive side of the ball, but ‚Äúno decision has been made‚Äù yet on defensive coordinator Matt Eberflus. Rapoport and Pelissero noted that meetings about the Cowboys‚Äô future will begin Monday, which could be when and where the organization makes a call on Eberflus‚Äô status.

Prior to the start of the 2025 season, the Cowboys traded superstar pass-rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers while in the midst of a contract stalemate. There were already concerns about Dallas‚Äô defense after ranking 28th in total defense and 31st in scoring defense last season, and the issues were amplified without Parsons.

Through 17 weeks this season, the Cowboys have the No. 30 overall defense and No. 32 scoring defense, allowing 376.8 total yards and 29.8 points per game.

That is primarily why the Cowboys missed the playoffs with a 7-8-1 record despite ranking first in the NFL in total offense and fourth in scoring offense. Not surprisingly, the Cowboys lacked a consistent pass-rush this season following the departure of Parsons, as they are tied for 23rd in the NFL with 31 sacks and don‚Äôt have a single player with more than 5.5 sacks on the year.A strong argument can be made that Eberflus simply didn‚Äôt have the personnel needed to succeed this season, but since it is easier to make a coaching change than it is to completely overhaul a defensive unit, Eberflus could prove to be a one-and-done DC in Dallas.When the Cowboys hired Eberflus to coach under first-year head coach Brian Schottenheimer, Eberflus was coming off a three-year run as head coach of the Chicago Bears.

The Cowboys have placed their top two veteran running backs on injured reserve, leaving the door opening for Phil Mafah and Jaydon Blue to see significant playing time.

FRISCO, Texas¬†‚Äî The end of the 2025 season has arrived for the Dallas Cowboys, and earlier than they‚Äôd like, but they‚Äôll at least try to avoid a second consecutive losing season when they travel to take on the New York.

Giants in Week 18. Achieving that mission just got a bit tougher, though. Though they are expected to start four-time Pro Bowl quarterback Dak Prescott at MetLife Stadium, the same can‚Äôt be said for some other key players ‚Äî sidelined due to injury. On Friday, the Cowboys ruled out Javonte Williams, Malik Davis, T.J. Bass, DeMarvion Overshown and rookie cornerback Shavon Revel.

One day later, they made a list of transactions that included moving several players to season-ending injured reserve, mostly academic, at this point, to clear the way for the activation of others from IR who have yet to touch the field this season. The decision to waive Trevon Diggs left one open seat on the 53-man roster but, given the laundry list of moves made on Saturday, that wasn‚Äôt enough. Three players were moved to IR and two activated, the additional seat being awarded to an undrafted, hard-hitting rookie and there was also an elevation to help with depth and special teams coverage.

The understandable decision to shut down both Williams and Davis not only opens the door for Mafah to try and build on his impressive preseason film, but also for fellow rookie running back Jaydon Blue to get another chance to show the Cowboys he is as advertised. Blue hasn‚Äôt been active in a game since late October, relegated to the inactives until head coach Brian Schottenheimer was satisfied with what he sees in practice, consistency-wise.

One of the top edge rushers in the draft says he would love to play for the Cowboys.

One of college football‚Äôs best is shining on the biggest stage.¬†Miami‚Äôs Rueben Bain Jr.¬†has recorded four sacks and 5.5 tackles for loss in the College Football Playoffs, and he‚Äôs making his pitch to Jerry Jones ahead of the 2026 NFL Draft.¬†The Cowboys obviously need help putting pressure on opposing quarterbacks, and they can easily get that with Bain Jr., one of the most highly rated prospects in the upcoming draft. Cowboys fans will love what Bain Jr. had to say to the¬†Fort Worth Star-Telegram¬†following Miami‚Äôs win against Ohio State. The star edge rusher says he would love to play for the Cowboys if given the opportunity.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôd be amazing. Any opportunity I can get, no matter where I‚Äôm playing, it‚Äôd be a blessing. I‚Äôve already made myself familiar with the [stadium] grounds. It‚Äôd be an amazing opportunity.‚Äù

Miami star edge rusher Rueben Bain Jr. says he would love to play for the Cowboys

The only thing that could stop Jones from drafting Bain Jr. would be if another team were to beat them to the punch. The Cowboys have also been linked to Texas Tech edge rusher David Bailey. Drafting him would be a win to fix their atrocious pass rush.¬†The losses to the Lions and Vikings served as harsh reminders that if Dallas were to draft two pass rushers in the first round, it wouldn‚Äôt be too extreme at all.

The defense was barely able to touch Jared Goff and J.J. McCarthy, allowing both quarterbacks to look like prime Tom Brady.¬†The¬†departure of Trevon Diggs¬†will have a lot of mock drafts predicting the Cowboys to take a cornerback with one of their two first-round picks. But a pass rusher should be the priority with their first pick, and Bain fits that bill.¬†Bain Jr. is a big body at 6-foot-3, 275 pounds, and he possesses the power and speed off the edge that Dallas badly needs. He and Donovan Ezeiruaku could end up becoming a real problem for the NFL.

Breaking down the Cowboys defensive plans versus the Giants.

In this episode of¬†Between the Lines, we flip the attention to the defensive line, where chaos meets strategy. This is where the Cowboys‚Äô games are won and lost so let‚Äôs dive in.

(2025 Stats: 643 Total snaps, 40 Total Tackles, 6 TFL, 51 Pressures, 3 Sack)

(2025 Stats: 392 Total snaps, 26 Total Tackles, 3 TFL, 12 Pressures, 0 Sacks, 1 PD)

(2025 Stats: 697 Total snaps, 35 Total Tackles, 6 TFL, 44 Pressures, 3 Sacks)

(2025 Stats: 89 Total snaps, 3 Total Tackle, 0 TFL, 1 Pressure, 0 Sacks)

(2025 Stats [including Jets]: 596 Total snaps, 48 Total Tackles, 11 TFL, 51 Pressures, 2.5 Sacks, 3 FF, 1 INT)

The heart of this matchup is easy, Dallas needs the big guys in the middle to squeeze the pocket and clog running lanes, while the Giants will try to keep the ball on schedule and get it out fast. The Cowboys have been strong up front this year. As a defense, Dallas ranks eighth in pass-rush win rate (40%) and fourth in run-stop win rate (32%). Inside, Osa Odighizuwa and Kenny Clark both show up on the win rate individual leaderboards, with Odighizuwa ranking eighth in pass rush and run stop win rate among defensive tackles, with Clark not far behind him. But it‚Äôs Quinnen Williams who‚Äôs the sledgehammer here, and the Giants‚Äô patched-up interior is exactly the kind of assignment that Williams can utilize his impact to create drive-ending plays. On the win-rate board, Williams is king in Dallas, ranking second among defensive tackles in Run Stop Win Rate at 46% with a 15% Pass Rush Win rate that ranks third, that‚Äôs top-shelf interior defense while consistently drawing extra help which helps the rest of the line. This is the core of Dallas‚Äô plan to force long down-and-distance situations.

The Giants‚Äô offensive line has been beat up. Left tackle Andrew Thomas and center John Michael Schmitz both hit injured reserve, so New York has turned to rookie Marcus Mbow at left tackle and veteran Austin Schlottmann at center. Before the injury, Thomas was a top-10 tackle in pass-block win rate, which shows the drop-off Dallas might be able to attack now that he‚Äôs sidelined. Communication inside between the guards and center becomes important, especially against stunts and late movement.

Even with the injuries, New York‚Äôs blocking profile isn‚Äôt a pushover. As a team, the Giants sit 11th in pass-block win rate, but 18th in run-block win rate. That suggests the ball is coming out on time and that they lean on a quick passing game to help the line. Dallas has to answer by winning early in the snap so the quick game doesn‚Äôt have time.

The quarterback picture is simple. Rookie Jaxson Dart is running the huddle. His year-one line reads 2,042 passing yards, 13 touchdowns, five picks, and he‚Äôs added useful yards with his legs in spots including adding nine rushing touchdowns. The Giants‚Äô run game is the other pillar. They rank sixth in rushing yards per game, with Tyrone Tracy Jr. at 637 yards and Devin Singletary adding 366 yards, both having to take the wheel with Cam Skattebo out for the year. That blend is exactly how New York tries to protect a banged-up front. Dallas‚Äô interior has to knock them off schedule on first down so second-and-long turns into a difficult and obvious passing play.

title: Audi Crooks may have her flaws, but she still looks more than championship-ready for No. 10 Iowa State
description: Audi Crooks seems to have finally overcome inconsistency, and that means Iowa State could win it all.
fullText:
Iowa State junior center Audi Crooks, who was only ranked the 57th best prospect in her high school class of 2023 by espnW, is transcending expectations yet again.

As a freshman at Iowa State, she quickly invited the attention of diehard hoops fans through interior dominance. Unfortunately, a flatlined performance against Stanford in the NCAA Tournament made many write off Crooks as a gimmick player with no versatility‚Äîfar from someone who could one day lead a team that contends for a national championship.

While Crooks took another step forward last season, Iowa State took a step back. The Cyclones lost in the first round of the tournament to Michigan. Crooks scored 28 in the Round of 64 loss to Michigan, which was still not enough to stop people from diagnosing her with ‚Äúregular-season player‚Äù syndrome. The question has never been whether Crooks is a good player. Instead, fans and analysts rightfully have wondered whether her play style can be sustained over a tournament run, and if it can translate to the WNBA.

Iowa State‚Äôs offense blossoms from the branches of Crooks‚Äô scoring. Opponents must choose a path: Leave perimeter shooters open and send help to Crooks, or stay tight on the 3-point line and let Crooks isolate on inferior post defenders. Most teams elect for the former, which is one of the reasons that Iowa State ranks 13th in the country in 3-point percentage (38.2 percent). Kansas recently tried the latter, and gave up 41 points to Crooks in a loss.

AUDI CROOKS TODAY üî•üî•üî•

‚Ä¢ 41 POINTS 
‚Ä¢ 4 REBOUNDS
‚Ä¢ 19/28 FG
‚Ä¢ 30 MINUTES PLAYEDpic.twitter.com/QABIwf0NZU

‚Äî Women‚Äôs Hoops Network (@WomensHoops_USA) December 21, 2025

The Cyclones offense embodies a rock and a hard place. That‚Äôs a good thing!

However, imagine being stuck between a rock and a hard place, but the rock is having a bad game. The rock is shooting 3-for-20. The rock looks more like a pebble this game. When you step over that pebble, it becomes a little harder (or, impossible) for the hard place to trap you. That‚Äôs been the modus operandi for Crooks and her production. When she has a great game, Iowa State is invincible. When she has a bad game, they‚Äôre powerless.

It can be reasoned that this is the case with all great players, but that isn‚Äôt entirely true.

While Crooks is an elite scorer, her frame and lack of three-dimensionality come back to bite her when the offensive engine isn‚Äôt clicking. She‚Äôs slow-footed on defense and can‚Äôt guard switches, nor can she keep up with mobile forwards. She is at risk of being beaten down the floor in transition if she misses a post finish. She‚Äôs actually a below-average rebounder for her size and usage. She‚Äôs not a threat to stretch the floor. Pointing out Crooks‚Äô coarse edges isn‚Äôt to say that she‚Äôs not a phenomenal player. Instead, it‚Äôs a recognition her limited ability to impact winning while having a bad game. If she isn‚Äôt scoring, her impact on the game is often negative.

Without a drastic change in Crooks‚Äô method, overcoming the looming threat of an off night isn‚Äôt possible. Crooks thrives because of who she is and how she plays, but she also pays the price for it when her shot isn‚Äôt falling. The steep, anxious mountain that Crooks has to climb to advance far in the NCAA Tournament, and even win a national champion, is one of invincibility. She cannot have a bad game. She cannot be a non-factor.

As we‚Äôve turned the calendar into conference play, somehow, Crooks is summiting.

First player in the last 17 years to have five straight 30-point games on 60% shooting or better!! That‚Äôs our @AudiCrooks ü§©

üå™Ô∏èüèÄüå™Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/FWUMP04vYD

‚Äî Cyclone Basketball (@CycloneWBB) December 31, 2025

In her third collegiate season, Crooks is scoring the basketball to such an extent that maybe she could just carry the Cyclones to a championship. She isn‚Äôt just a niche pull in ‚Äúball-knower‚Äù conversations anymore. She‚Äôs encroaching on household-name status.

Crooks leads the country in scoring at 29.4 points per game. Even more remarkable, she‚Äôs second in the country in field goal percentage at 72.5 percent. Never before has there been such an intersection of volume and efficiency. It wouldn‚Äôt be crazy at all to say that Crooks is having one of the greatest scoring seasons in women‚Äôs basketball history. The gap in efficiency rating between Crooks and the second-highest player, UConn‚Äôs Sarah Strong, is greater than the gap between Strong and the 10th most efficient player.

Iowa State is shooting 38 percent from 3 (13th in the country) and 60 percent on 2-pointers (first in the country). They‚Äôre the sixth highest-scoring offense in college basketball, and a 14-0 record has them at No. 10 in the most recent AP Poll.

Audi Crooks in a 80-62 win @ Houston : 35 points on 17-21 shooting, 1-1 from the FT line & 13 rebounds in 34 minutes (5th straight game with 30+ points) pic.twitter.com/7sYfPaprKQ

‚Äî Lee Harvey (@Sayian_Warrior) December 31, 2025

Maybe the question shouldn‚Äôt be, ‚ÄúCan Iowa State overcome a bad Audi Crooks game?‚Äù Maybe the key to Iowa State‚Äôs success comes from Crooks‚Äô ‚Äúbad‚Äù being no longer being ‚Äúbad.‚Äù. She‚Äôs not going to score 30 points every game (although sometimes it feels like it), but if a ‚Äúbad‚Äù Audi Crooks game can look like 14 points, rather than four, the Cyclones can get somewhere.

For the first time in her career, Crooks‚Äô dominance is at such a level that it feels sustainable. It feels consistent. Summiting her mountain, Crooks can now afford to fall from her peak on occasion. She just can‚Äôt find herself at base camp.

title: Basketball Preview: MSU vs USC
description: Both Spartans and Trojans look to get back in the win column Monday at the Breslin
fullText:
Your ninth ranked Michigan State Spartans will be back in action at home Monday night to take on their fourth Big Ten opponent of the 2025-26 campaign: the USC Trojans (12-2, 1-2). The Spartans will also enter this matchup with a record of 12-2, and are in the midst of their worst stretch of the season to this point. Since a close December 6th loss at home to Duke, the last month of MSU Basketball has been underwhelming, to say the least. State has allowed inferior opponents like Penn State, Oakland, and Cornell to hang around, and this sloppy play finally caught up to them Friday night on the road against a fiery Nebraska Cornhusker team, losing 58-56 to the tune of 19 turnovers.

USC, the 24th ranked team in the land, will head to East Lansing following a crushing loss on the road in ann arbor Friday night. Similarly to Michigan State, the Trojans committed 21 turnovers. However, unlike our Spartans, USC was not able to overcome these mistakes and lost in blowout fashion, 96-66. This brings the Trojans to a 1-2 record in Big Ten play thus far, having split their first pair conference games against Oregon and Washington.

So, what‚Äôs the scoop on Southern Cal? Their record and AP Top 25 ranking are a credit to the ability of Eric Musselman‚Äôs squad to win close games in their non-conference schedule. USC put together a non-con resume that includes a narrow victory over Grand Canyon, an overtime win against the (Troy) Trojans, and three impressive triumphs in Hawaii against the likes of Boise State, Seton Hall, and Arizona State to take home the Maui Invitational Title. The trip to Hawaii was a key inflection point for USC, as they returned to the mainland with not only the trophy, but with a huge new question to be answered- who will be able step up after a key injury to star combo guard Rodney Rice. The junior had been averaging upwards of 20 points and 6 assists per game, before suffering an injury to his right shoulder against Seton Hall. In his absence, several Trojans have stepped up to help shoulder the load and continue putting up impressive offensive numbers (apparently except against uofm). Let‚Äôs take a look at the main contributors for this USC squad, with likely starters in bold.

#9: Ryan Cornish, Guard ‚Äì 6‚Äô5 173 lbs

#4: Chad Baker-Mazara, Forward ‚Äì 6‚Äô7 172 lbs

#5: Terrance Williams II, Forward- 6‚Äô7 235 lbs

#6: Jacob Cofie, Forward ‚Äì 6‚Äô10 231 lbs

#2: Ezra Ausar, Forward ‚Äì 6‚Äô9 253 lbs

#7: Jordan Marsh, Guard ‚Äì 5‚Äô11 146 lbs

#8: Jerry Easter II, Guard ‚Äì 6‚Äô5 193 lbs

#45: Gabe Dynes, Center ‚Äì 7‚Äô5 214 lbs

#13: Kam Woods, Guard ‚Äì 6‚Äô2 185 lbs

Even in the face of injuries to Rice and Senior Guard Armorion Dickerson, the Trojan rotation is a deep one, especially in their frontcourt. USC can utilize the towering Center Gabe Dynes in big lineups, or play more of a small ball style with Ezra Ausar sliding into the five spot.

In terms of the backcourt, USC recently turned heads with a fascinating move that, to take a wild guess, Tom Izzo is not a fan of. Perhaps some Spartan fans recall watching Kam Woods play for the Robert Morris Colonials a season ago in the Cleveland regional of the 2025 NCAA Tournament. Well, this season, Woods entered the transfer portal but had yet to find a new home. That is, until December 18th, when he made headlines as an in-season transfer portal signing with immediate eligibility. Woods has given Eric Musselman and co some much needed depth at the guard position, and has already logged 22 and 16 minutes in games against UC Santa Cruz and michigan, respectively.

Since the injury to Rice, Senior Chad Baker-Mazara has stepped up as the focal point of USC‚Äôs offense, and his numbers speak for themselves. Baker-Mazara is averaging an impressive 20.4 points and 5.1 rebounds, especially eye-opening when considering Rice had also been averaging north of 20 points a night. Additionally, USC has a solid big in Ezra Ausar, who is good for 17.1 PPG, playing both the 4 and 5 spots. Long story short? The Trojans have the ability to score at a very high rate, and had not scored under 70 points until their loss to michigan.

Friday Night: Outliers or Areas of Concern?

Both programs are in a surprisingly similar place. Needless to say, coaches Tom Izzo and Eric Musselman were certainly disappointed with both of their team‚Äôs performances this past Friday. A combined 40(!) turnovers between the Spartans and Trojans in their respective matchups made a road victory in either game nearly impossible. Similar to how USC has missed the presence of a second superstar guard in Rodney Rice, Michigan State certainly felt the absence and ball-handling ability of combo guard Divine Ugochukwu against Nebraska. The good news for Spartan fans- there is hope that Divine will be able to return Monday night, as he was suffering from illness, rather than injury, in Lincoln that made him unable to suit up.

Friday night brought with it uncharacteristic losses for both teams. Michigan State, a team that this year has been 10-deep, with key contributors coming off the bench, earned only three points from non-starters against Nebraska. On the other hand, the high powered USC offense was stymied against michigan. The Trojans began the game with three straight turnovers, and dug themselves an 11-0 hole, unable to score until the 13:19 minute mark of the first half.

Taking a closer look, both of Friday night‚Äôs top-25 matchups involving these two squads represented a diversion from each of these teams‚Äô own identities and styles of play. Southern Cal assisted on only 4 of their 20 made field goals against michigan, compared to their season average prior to Friday, which was 17.1 per game. The ball was sticking for the Trojans in ann arbor, with far too many unsuccessful attempts at isolation basketball against a stifling wolverine defense. Chad Baker-Mazara also picked up four first half fouls, heavily impacting his second half defense, and coming as a result of Coach Musselman desperately needing offensive production late in the 1H.

For the green and white, it was beyond just statistics. For the most part against Nebraska, MSU did not play like a team whose mantra is defend, rebound, and run. While State did out-rebound the Cornhuskers and prove successful in holding their opponent to only 58 points, the transition game was missed dearly as Michigan State continues to suffer from a stagnant half court offense. Tom Izzo‚Äôs team scored only 6 fast break points, and for most of the game played at a pace as dictated by Nebraska. This spelled disaster to the tune of a loss and only 56 points scored in Lincoln.

The road does not get any easier for a Michigan State team desperate to get back to the basketball it was playing prior to the Duke game. Nor does it for a USC team hungry to atone for Friday‚Äôs embarrassing loss before leaving the state of Michigan. Monday‚Äôs matchup will feature two teams coming off poor performances who should have no problem getting up for this one. While still incredibly early into conference play, this game has the feel of a must-win matchup for either of these teams, both needing a win to stay on track in the race for a Big Ten title.

Which team will look most improved from their last time out? Which team can limit turnovers? These questions and more will be answered at 8:30 Monday night in front of what will hopefully be a raucous alumni Izzone crowd.

title: Is Javonte Williams playing today? Update for Cowboys RB in Week 18
description: The breakout season for the Cowboys' running back has led to some late-year injury concerns. Is he suiting up for the finale?
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys proved themselves right in 2025. For the last several years, they've reworked their philosophy about the run game, choosing to be penny wise in forming their backfield. After moving on from Ezekiel Elliott, they franchise-tagged Tony Pollard before letting him walk and replacing him with Rico Dowdle. Dowdle was then replaced this season by Javonte Williams, who was placed in a brand new offensive attack orchestrated by new head coach Brian Schottenheimer and new OC Klayton Adams.

Williams responded with the best RB season in Dallas since 2019, with over 1,200 yards on the ground, another 100-plus receiving and 13 total touchdowns. He has been able to last injury-free through much of the season, but alas he hasn't made it to the actual finish line.

Williams was knocked out of the Cowboys' Week 15 game with a shoulder/neck injury during the first half. He was replaced by Malik Davis for a while, but he was able to return to the game. He played in Week 16 and Week 17, but left the last contest midway through, again ceding his role to Davis. Now he's on the final injury report for 2025 with those same shoulder and neck ailments.

In fact, he's not just on the injury report, Williams has been ruled out of the contest, ending his season with the Cowboys. He is set to be a free agent in 2026.

Williams has toted the rock 252 times for 1,201 yards and 11 rushing touchdowns. he's also caught 35 of 51 passes for 137 yards and another two scores, giving him 13 on the season.

title: Is there a Sunday Night Football game tonight? NFL Week 18 schedule
description: There's been a prime time NFL game Sunday night every week since early September. But is there a "Sunday Night Football" game tonight?
fullText:
"Sunday Night Football" brought us one of the games of the year in Week 17.

The host San Francisco 49ers and Chicago Bears traded blows throughout all four quarters in a dazzling offensive display. It's the third week in a row in which the final game of the Sunday slate was a one-score affair; the 49ers' 42-38 win is the latest following the Patriots' 28-24 win in Week 16 over the Ravens and the Vikings' 34-26 win over the Cowboys.

Teams have put on a show all season in prime time for a national audience. All 32 teams will be in action this weekend, the final week of the regular season; every contest is a division matchup.

Will that slate include one more prime time matchup to cap off Sunday's action? Here's what to know.

Yes, there is a "Sunday Night Football" game in Week 18. It's a high-stakes divisional matchup to boot: the Baltimore Ravens and Pittsburgh Steelers face off to decide who wins the AFC North.

Pittsburgh could've made things tougher for the Ravens by winning in Week 17 over last-placed Cleveland. Instead, the Steelers' offense stumbled, and the Browns won 13-6. That result and the Ravens' win over the Packers a day earlier set up a winner-takes-all Week 18 matchup.

Whichever team wins on "Sunday Night Football" will win the AFC North title and earn the No. 4 seed in the AFC playoffs.

Here's a look back at the full slate of Sunday night games this year. This list does not include NBC's special broadcasts in Week 1 (kickoff game), Thanksgiving and the Peacock holiday exclusive in Week 17:

title: Where to watch D3 football championship: TV channel, live stream, time for North Central vs. UW-River Falls Stagg Bowl
description: Will the Cardinals repeat or will the Falcons take their first national title? Here's how to tune in.
fullText:
Where to watch D3 football championship: TV channel, live stream, time for North Central vs. UW-River Falls Stagg Bowl originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The 2025 NCAA Division III football season comes to an end Sunday with preeminent power North Central facing championship newcomer Wisconsin-River Falls for the national championship.

It's the sixth consecutive Stagg Bowl appearance for the Cardinals (14-0), who have won two of the last three D3 titles and spent the entire season ranked atop the polls.

The Falcons (13-1) are the upstarts, playing for a national title for the first time in their first D3 playoffs appearance since 1996. UWRF has plenty of weapons, though. Quarterback Kaleb Blaha threw for 520 yards in a wild semifinal win over Johns Hopkins and leads the nation with a D3-record 5,770 yards of total offense.

Can Blaha and Co. outgun North Central's nearly unstoppable offense? The Cardinals average 49.4 points and 491 yards per game, led by QB Garret Wilson (42 TDs, 4 interceptions) and running back Donovan McNeal (1,462 rushing yards, 11 TDs).

title: NFL playoff schedule: Times, dates, TV info for wild-card games
description: The NFL playoff schedule is almost here, with the full setup of times, dates and TV info for matchups in the wild-card round to come after Week 18.
fullText:
Just like the postseason field itself, the NFL playoff schedule is about to be set.

With a little more than a month remaining until Super Bowl 60 in Santa Clara, California, 14 teams are about to embark on a journey that they hope will lead to a Lombardi Trophy. Before they can take their first steps, however, they'll have to learn when and where they'll be facing off against their initial opponents, starting with wild-card weekend.

Things will kickoff next Saturday with two contests, and three more will follow Sunday. Then the action will wrap up with the final showdown on Monday night.

title: Wisconsin football lands commitment from Iowa State transfer safety

Van Dinter recently entered the portal after two years at Iowa State. He originally joined the Cyclones as a three-star recruit in the class of 2024, ranked specifically as the No. 1,487 player in the class, the No. 142 safety and the No. 12 player from the state of Wisconsin.

The Kaukauna, Wisconsin, native appeared in 13 games over two seasons with the Cyclones, 11 of which came as a redshirt freshman in 2025. He totaled 18 tackles and 1/2 for loss during that limited action. 247Sports currently lists the safety as a three-star transfer recruit. He's specifically ranked as the No. 852 player in the portal and the No. 87 transfer at his position.

The Wisconsin native joins a Badgers safety room that saw veteran starter Preston Zachman enter the portal following the 2025 campaign. The room will have snaps available, with 2025 starters Zachman and Austin Brown both gone from the depth chart.

title: NFL insiders discuss Raheem Morris, Terry Fontenot's job security
description: Will the Falcons keep head coach Raheem Morris and GM Terry Fontenot? NFL insiders weigh in
fullText:
The Atlanta Falcons were supposed to turn the corner with head coach Raheem Morris at the helm, but it's been nearly two full seasons and they have yet to take that next step. Morris is 15-18 overall entering Sunday's season finale against the New Orleans Saints.

After winning three straight games, though, Morris' seat seems to have cooled down considerably. While the team has already been eliminated from playoff contention, the Falcons' recent winning streak has shaken up the NFC South division race.

If Atlanta wins on Sunday, the Carolina Panthers will NFC South champs. If the Falcons lose, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers will clinch their fifth straight division title. But will a late-season winning streak be enough for Morris to save his job?

As we approach another Black Monday, NFL insiders have been gathering intel on each coaching situation. Let's see what those around the league are hearing about Morris and general manager Terry Fontenot.

According to Dianna Russini of The Athletic, Falcons owner Arthur Blank is expected to bring in a consulting firm to evaluate everything. Russini even suggested that the team may keep Morris and move on from Fontenot in the offseason.

That work is expected to be weighed alongside the organization‚Äôs internal evaluations: two seasons (and a 15-18 record) under coach Raheem Morris, five seasons under Fontenot, how this year has unfolded, the perceived state of the roster and the franchise‚Äôs overall team-building approach. Many around the league expect the Falcons to move on from Fontenot and stick with Morris as coach. One potential added voice to the mix? Former quarterback Matt Ryan, who is¬†in talks to return to the organization¬†in a front-office role. -- Dianna Russini, The Athletic

ESPN's Jeremy Fowler also put out a feature discussing NFL coaches on the hot seat. Fowler said the Falcons haven't given up on Morris, but Arthur Blank clearly wanted to see more from the team over the last two years.

The Falcons have not quit on Morris, who has railed off three consecutive wins to make his case for a third year in Atlanta. But that doesn't ensure his return. Morris would most likely need to make staff changes if he does stay. Special teams has been a bugaboo, and quarterback Michael Penix Jr.'s development hasn't proceeded as hoped. -- Jeremy Fowler, ESPN

Over at NFL.com, Ian Rapoport and Tom Pelissero released a new hot-seat breakdown. The Falcons have been a disappointment, but it sounds like Morris may have bought himself some goodwill with that upset win over the Rams.

And for as disappointing as the Falcons were even a month ago, they‚Äôve found a spark down the stretch, playing hard for head coach Raheem Morris and winning three games in a row with formerly demoted veteran Kirk Cousins at quarterback. The reason owners wait to see the entire product is to learn how a team responds to adversity. And with all eyes on them, Atlanta beat the Los Angeles Rams on national TV on Monday night. It gives Blank a lot to think about as he weighs the futures of Morris, who has three years left on his contract, and GM Terry Fontenot, who has one. -- Ian Rapoport & Tom Pelissero, NFL.com

The Falcons will close out the season against the Saints at 1 p.m. on Sunday afternoon. Once the team makes a decision on Morris and Fontenot, it will be on to free agency for Atlanta. Some key players, including tight end Kyle Pitts and linebacker Kaden Elliss, will be free agents.

This article originally appeared on Falcons Wire: Atlanta Falcons: NFL insiders on Raheem Morris' job status

title: Texas A&M could host Oklahoma State transfer Edge soon

fullText:
The Pittsburgh Steelers may have gotten a good look at their next potential starting quarterback in the Green Bay Packers' Week 17 matchup against the Baltimore Ravens, where one quarterback broke out for a monster game, leaving fans stunned.

title: Why did Kai Havertz miss Bournemouth-Arsenal clash?
description: Kai Havertz was absent from Arsenal‚Äôs squad to face AFC Bournemouth on Saturday, but there‚Äôs reportedly no cause for concern.Photo by Stu Forster/Getty ImagesArsenal had a few injury concerns ahea...
fullText:
Arsenal had a few injury concerns ahead of this weekend‚Äôs match against Bournemouth, with Max Dowman, Riccardo Calafiori, and Cristhian Mosquera all ruled out of action, and doubts around the fitness of Declan Rice.

Rice managed to overcome his knee swelling to make the squad and score a brace, but there was an unexpected absence in the form of Kai Havertz.

Havertz had returned to the Arsenal squad for the previous game against Aston Villa, recovering from a knee injury to be involved. So there were initial fears that perhaps his absence on Saturday could indicate a setback, especially as the forward hadn‚Äôt been spotted in training the previous day.

Fortunately, Sam Blitz of Sky Sports reported ahead of the game that there‚Äôs no setback to Havertz, and his absence is just load management.

Havertz obviously hasn‚Äôt been playing games, so ‚Äúload‚Äù here doesn‚Äôt refer to his minutes on the pitch competitively. Instead, it refers to the load he‚Äôs been taking on in training, working to return to his best.

Arsenal will obviously also need to be extra careful with an injured player who has been out of action for over four months, who already had a setback in November.

On top of all of that, Arsenal already had a striker and a backup striker available in the squad.

There wasn‚Äôt a desperate need for Havertz in this particular fixture, and sitting on the bench on a bitterly cold day would probably do a lot less good to the forward than remaining home.

Arsenal fans will be looking forward to Havertz making regular appearances in the squad over the remainder of the season, but caution is the best way to ensure that happens.

title: Micah's takeaways from a dominant week for the Big Ten
description: Indiana embarrassed Alabama and Oregon shut out Texas Tech. The Big Ten showed it has the best teams in CFB and is guaranteed to play for the title
fullText:
It was a great week for the Big Ten The national championship game is guaranteed to have a team that resides in the Big Ten Conference. The title game won't feature two Big Ten teams, but there is no doubt that the best game in this playoff and the best game this season might be the upcoming semifinal between two Big Ten teams, Indiana and Oregon.

Here are my takeaways from the Big Ten from this Week's bowl games:

From wins like Iowa over Vandy, Illinois over Tennessee, a high-powered offense, all the way to Indiana beating Alabama, the Big Ten showcased they are the best conference in the country. The Big Ten lost Ohio State as a representative, but with the matchup between Oregon and Indiana, that could very well be the team that wins it all. Indiana very well looks like the best team remaining by a wide margin. Texas did get the best of Michigan, but everyone is clearly aware of what has been going on in Michigan prior to that bowl game. It is safe to say that the Big Ten runs college football.

Against Alabama, Fernando Mendoza was as good as he could possibly be. Mendoza was 14-16, threw for 192 yards through the air, and threw for 3 passing touchdowns. Many of his other counterparts struggled, while Mendoza continues to win and continues to be the reason why Indiana is winning. At this current moment, Mendoza looks like a sure thing quarterback prospect for the next draft class, and he will make one desperate NFL team very happy.

Indiana was the one team that had a bye week in the College Football Playoff that did not lose. Not only did they not lose to Alabama, but they won the game in the first half. Ty Simpson had no chance, and this was a complete football performance by Indiana and Curt Cignetti. The Hoosiers are undefeated this year, and last season they only lost two games, one of which was in last season's College Football Playoff. Cignetti consistently has this team ready to dominate regardless of the opponent. He has a Big Ten title for the first time in program history, and he is looking for much more this season. This two-year run for Cignetti in Indiana places him as the best coach in college football right now, and it is not close, just like the coaching match between him and Kalen DeBoer on Thursday.

Indiana is a team that has not shown any weakness this season. In games that could have resulted in an upset this season, Indiana has a guy who can win them games in the clutch in Fernando Mendoza. This team has an elite quarterback, they have elite weapons as Omar Cooper Jr. returned versus Alabama, and their defense is just as good as any team left. This team is well coached, and their team is full of players at every level who have been in college football for at least 4 years. The steamrolling of Alabama was a surprise to no one. Indiana made their statement on Thursday and proved it is the team to beat.

The last time these two teams met, Indiana won 30-20. That game was a battle, and both quarterbacks struggled and faced adversity. Mendoza proved to be the quarterback who battled adversity the best. Against Indiana was the first time Dante Moore struggled and did not have his usual success. For Oregon to win, they will need Dante Moore to be the better quarterback. In all the other areas on their team, Oregon matches up very well against Indiana, and their defense showed that by completely shutting out Texas Tech. Once again, these two teams will deliver one of the best games of this season. In my opinion, whoever wins this game will win the whole thing.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Big Ten football teams handled the SEC in New Year's bowl games

title: Chelsea‚Äôs next manager doesn‚Äôt seem to want the job as his number is called early
description: Chelsea‚Äôs sister club Strasbourg drew 1-1 with Nice last night, but the real story was off the pitch, where Liam Rosenior was being asked about his imminent move to take over as Chelsea boss.It‚Äôs ...
fullText:
Chelsea‚Äôs sister club Strasbourg drew 1-1 with Nice last night, but the real story was off the pitch, where Liam Rosenior was being asked about his imminent move to take over as Chelsea boss.

It‚Äôs been clear that the Blues are lining him up as their first choice to replace Enzo Maresca after the Italian coach left the club earlier this week. And Rosenior is the obvious next up, given he‚Äôs effectively been groomed in Ligue 1 to one day coach at Chelsea.

His quotes are hardly enthusiastic, however. This chance has come earlier that it was supposed to, and he knows it.

Liam Rosenior managing Strasbourg. (Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)

‚ÄúI love this group. I love this club, more than most people probably think. I‚Äôve had the 18 best months of my professional career, for sure, I‚Äôve made many good friends, I have so much respect for the people here,‚Äù Rosenior said, confirming the move without confirming it.

‚ÄúThings aren‚Äôt concrete, there may be interest, we‚Äôll see. And at the end of the day, I want to focus on Strasbourg and not other things at the moment. I haven‚Äôt discussed anything at this point. I know that they‚Äôre (Chelsea) looking for a manager.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a tough spot ‚Äì you can‚Äôt turn down a promotion from your boss, but when you know you‚Äôre not qualified, it‚Äôs a poison pill.

Chelsea need their most experienced players to step up and help them in this tricky moment, and Pedro Neto is among them. He spoke a little about how he and his teammates can rise to the challenge.

David Datro Fofana is finally at a club where he‚Äôs playing and scoring regularly, and he decided to take the chance to apologise to Chelsea fans for not being able to show them his best in his time at the club.

title: Fury comes out of retirement... again
description: Former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury announces he will return to boxing in 2026, bringing an end to his latest spell of retirement.
fullText:
Former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury has announced he will return to boxing in 2026, bringing an end to his latest spell of retirement.

The 37-year-old Briton last fought in December 2024, when he was beaten for a second time by unified champion Oleksandr Usyk in their heavyweight rematch. Fury confirmed his retirement a month later.

Speculation over a comeback had grown in recent weeks after Fury shared footage of himself training in Thailand alongside South African boxer Kevin Lerena.

Posting on Instagram on Sunday, Fury said: "2026 is that year. Return of the Mac. Been away for a while but I'm back now. 37 years old and still punching. Nothing better to do than punch men in the face & get paid for it."

Fury's return to the ring was widely expected. His most recent retirement was met with scepticism last year, given his history of reversals.

He previously stepped away from boxing after stopping Dillian Whyte at Wembley Stadium in April 2022, only to return six months later.

Queensberry promoter Frank Warren said he expected Fury to fight again. Saudi Arabia powerbroker Turki Alalshikh had reportedly planned for Fury and long-time rival Anthony Joshua to take separate bouts in the Kingdom early in 2026 before finally meeting later in the year.

Joshua fuelled that possibility after defeating Jake Paul in December, saying he was ready to face Fury next.

Those plans are now uncertain after Joshua was injured in a car crash in Nigeria that claimed the lives of two close friends.

Fury enjoyed two reigns as heavyweight champion and boasts a professional record of 34 wins, two defeats - both against Usyk - and one draw with Deontay Wilder.

He stunned long-reigning champion Wladimir Klitschko in 2015 to claim the WBA (Super), IBF, WBO and The Ring heavyweight titles in Germany.

After more than two and a half years away from the ring, during which he addressed mental health struggles, Fury returned in 2018 and regained world champion status by defeating Wilder in 2020 to win the WBC title.

Fury has spoken openly about wanting to avenge his defeats by Usyk, who currently holds the WBA (Super), WBC, IBF and WBO belts.

There appears to be limited appetite among fans for a trilogy, while the Ukrainian has indicated he would prefer to defend his titles against Wilder next.

One potential route to world-title contention could be a domestic clash with Fabio Wardley, the current WBO champion and another fighter promoted by Warren's Queensberry stable.

title: Semantic Redaction: Why Context Matters for Privacy in AI
description: Discover why Regex destroys LLM performance and how Semantic Redaction protects PII while preserving the context and grammar your AI needs to reason effectively.
fullText:
For the last twenty years, data security has largely been a game of "Find and Destroy."

In the era of databases and emails, protecting Personally Identifiable Information (PII) was a binary problem. If a credit card number appeared in a log, you scrubbed it. If a social security number appeared in an email, you blocked it. The tool of choice was Regular Expressions (Regex). That's simple, rigid pattern matching.

But we aren't working with databases anymore. We are working with Large Language Models or LLMs (well, we still are working with databases of course, but you know what I mean).

When you apply the blunt force of Regex to the delicate probability engines of GenAI, you might secure the data, but you often break the intelligence. To build AI that is both safe and smart, we need to move beyond pattern matching toward Semantic Redaction.

Here is why context matters, and why your redaction strategy is likely killing your LLM‚Äôs performance.

Imagine you are handing a legal contract to a human lawyer, but before you do, you take a sharpie and blackout every name, date, and corporation. You then ask the lawyer: "Who is liable in this agreement?"

The lawyer can‚Äôt answer. Not because they don't know the law, but because you destroyed the relational context necessary to apply it.

Regex-based redaction functions like that black sharpie. It looks for patterns (like [A-Z][a-z]+) and replaces them with a generic mask like [REDACTED] or ******.

LLMs operate on probability. They predict the next token based on the sequence of tokens that came before. When you replace a specific entity with a generic mask, you flatten the probability distribution.

"John told Mary that he couldn't attend the meeting because Alice was sick."

If you use a simple Regex or keyword list to redact this, you might get:

"*** told *** that he couldn't attend the *** because *** was sick."

To an LLM (and a human for that matter), this sentence is now mathematically and semantically garbage. The model has lost the subject-object relationships (Attention is all you need, remember?). It doesn't know who told whom, or who (or what) was sick. If you ask the LLM "Why did John miss the meeting?", it will hallucinate or refuse to answer because the critical anchors of the narrative are gone.

Semantic Redaction (often powered by Named Entity Recognition or NER or nowadays Small Language Models SLMs) takes a different approach. Instead of destroying the data, it transforms it while preserving the structure.

It doesn't just look for patterns; it looks for context. It understands that "Apple" in "Apple pie" is a food, but "Apple" in "Apple Inc." is an organization.

More importantly, it replaces sensitive data with Typed Tokens that maintain referential integrity.

Let‚Äôs look at that previous example through the lens of Semantic Redaction.

"John told Mary that he couldn't attend the meeting because Alice was sick."

"[PERSON_1] told [PERSON_2] that he couldn't attend the meeting because [PERSON_3] was sick."

This looks similar, but to an LLM, it is a world of difference.

Type Safety: The model knows [PERSON_1] is a human, not a location or a date. It retains the reasoning that humans have agency and can "tell" things.

Consistency: If [PERSON_1] appears later in the document, the model understands it is the same person.

Grammar: The sentence structure remains intact.

Now, if you ask the LLM "Why did [PERSON_1] miss the meeting?", it can accurately reason: "Because [PERSON_3] was sick."

The secret remains safe‚Äîthe LLM never saw "John" or "Alice"‚Äîbut the logic of the interaction was preserved.

Advanced infrastructure tools like Rehydra go a step beyond simple placeholders. They analyze and preserve non-identifiable attributes (such as grammatical gender) to maintain linguistic fluency.

In our example, "John" is associated with the pronoun "he." If a redaction tool strips away all gender indicators, the LLM might get confused, producing robotic outputs like "The entity couldn't attend" or incorrectly guessing "She couldn't attend."

Rehydra solves this by attaching metadata to the token. It detects that [PERSON_1] is male and [PERSON_2] is female without revealing who they are. This allows the LLM to use the correct pronouns (he/him or she/her) in its response, ensuring the generated text reads naturally while the actual identities remain completely opaque.

The ultimate goal of Semantic Redaction isn't just to hide data; it's to make the AI useful. This leads to the concept of Rehydration.

Because we used unique placeholders ([PERSON_1]), we can create a secure lookup table locally. When the LLM sends back its answer "The agreement states that [PERSON_3] is liable" the local system can instantly swap the token back to the real name.

The user sees the real data. The AI sees the safe tokens. The compliance team sees a clean audit log.

As we move from simple chatbots to complex autonomous agents, the quality of our inputs matters more than ever. We cannot afford to treat AI prompts like dirty database logs that need to be scrubbed into oblivion.

Security doesn't have to mean stupidity. By moving from Regex to Semantic Redaction, we allow our LLMs to reason about our data without ever actually seeing it. We keep the context, and we keep the secrets.

Rehydra (Github) provides the infrastructure for semantic anonymization and real-time rehydration. Stop fighting with Regex and start building safe, intelligent AI.
